results.author: Hugh
results.text: I have been a customer of Amazon for more than ten years. Last Friday I was locked out of my account and told various conflicting stories by representatives of amazon uk customer service ie no account existed for my email, or the account had been blocked for security reasons.This was made worse by the fact that every single email I send is answered by a different person who has no idea what the previous person has done.Eventually I extracted a working phone number from them, the first one I was sent was out of date (unbelievable I know). On the phone I was told that nothing could be done because it had been escalated to a specialist security team who would call me within 24 hours. Needless to say, 5 days later, I have still not been called.Its an absolute disgrace.
results.title: I have been a customer of Amazon for more than ten years

results.author: ExpertReviewer
results.text: I previously left a five star review published on 05 July 2017 and updated it on 05 July 2017. I've been a regular spender with Amazon.co.uk for well over a decade, almost fourteen years in fact!Lately, the service has taken a complete nosedive. When I signed up for Prime each year, it was for the rapid deliveries because I always ordered a lot, something every day even. I don't use the music streaming and the only show I watch on Prime Video is Outlander, since Extant was cancelled.This year, it's all gone down the pan. Prime labelled items, which should be delivered the next day or within two days maximum, are taking way longer.When I complain, I get told 'your local fulfilment centres do not have the stock so it is coming from a FC abroad.' Why do they show on Amazon.CO.UK as in stock and Prime items then? If I wanted to order an item that was coming from France or Italy, I'd use Amazon.fr ot .it. I don't.The worst it's been was this week. I ordered a supposedly 'in stock' and 'Prime' flagged DVD. It's going to take SIX days to come. How is SIX days acceptable for Prime?! eBay and Base items come quicker than that using Royal Rubbish!Whenever I complain I get told 'we'll extend your Prime membership for thirty days as a goodwill gesture.' WHY would I want another thirty days of bad service? Why would you offer me an extension of a service that is a complete failure as of this year? Oh yes, giving me a free month of dreadfully slow and NOT Prime, Prime deliveries is really a goodwill gesture. I want what I paid for. I don't want an extra month of an absolutely appalling 'service.' See my last review, I was a HUGE fan, very loyal and a very regular and high spend customer. I'll be going elsewhere in future. If Royal Rubbish - who are terrible - can deliver items quicker than Amazon Logistics can deliver supposedly 'Prime' items, then I'd rather use them. My last formal complaint letter, sent on 31 October 2017 has thus far been ignored.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------EDIT: Update 11.12.17: My complaint letter has still been ignored to date. I ordered a 'Prime' flagged item with a 'guaranteed' delivery date only for the order to take six days to arrive from a foreign fulfilment centre. If it's not in stock in the UK and they cannot adhere to Prime delivery timescales, then they shouldn't lie and state it's both Prime AND in stock. Will be closing my account after fourteen years once my outstanding orders arrive. Competitors offer the same service for the same price. As Amazon deliveries are now as slow as a snail, there's no incentive to keep giving them my business.Furthermore, I logged into one of my credit card accounts today to see that Amazon had done the whole 'reserving 1 to verify the card' thing. The card was previously verified and had not been used on recent orders, yet they illegally made the request to my card without my knowledge and without any reason to do so (the card having been previously verified and it being unused in recent months). Had I used the card, I could understand them doing it, which is what happened when I first added the card. However, this is the second time they've verified the card and this time without me even using it. I store my card details there on the assumption that they're safe, not so that Amazon can make requests to them without my knowledge.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------EDIT: Update 22.12.17. Ordered a new coat stand. Flagged as Prime and in stock but took SIX days to arrive. When it arrived, despite the packaging being secure and perfect condition, the product was abysmally poor. Paint/varnish scratched off, screws with warped, melted metal that probably wouldn't grip. Base cracked, chipped and would crumble after limited use. Very poor service from Amazon and very poor product from the Ashley brand.The BBC posted an article stating that the UK Advertising Standards Authority was considering action against Amazon for lying about and misleading customers about Prime delivery timescales. You should all submit a complaint to ASA, I'm definitely going to!
results.title: 2017 has been a terrible year for Prime and customer service.

results.author: Michael Codori
results.text: Customer service is awful! A 5 year old has more common sense. The past 6 months, 9 out of 10 deliveries havent made it to my home. So frustrated and a waste of money.
results.title: Customer service is awful

results.author: AG
results.text: There is no better customer service than Amazons.These guys really have climbed to the top because of this. They are helpful, no long holds or annoying music and they will make you happy.Well done Amazon!
results.title: There is no better customer service

results.author: Shannon Craig
results.text: so far happy with prime service, I get what i need at reasonable prices and get it delivered to my doorstep
results.title: so far happy with prime service

results.author: Kerry dickinson
results.text: Love this site use it daily
results.title: Love this site use it daily

results.author: Jackie Morrison
results.text: My son bought a blu-ray dvd from a seller called all your music. It arrived faulty and he returned it as he was advised by Amazon to get a receipt. Now they say receipt not enough proof and basically make out he's lying for the sake of 30. The seller has got this back and can now sell it twice and the customer again loses out, here. Beware of this third party seller as Amazon don't cover you for their failings and its up to you to try get money back. Post office will be next visit just to prove to Amazon that for sake of 30 and helping a customer to get a refund, they won't help.. Buyer beware here and do not buy third party or from Amazon.Prime is another joke as says next day delivery but it runs into three or four days so your wasting your hard earned cash signing up for this poor service.Amazon has gone right down hill these days and yesterdays deliveries the Amazon logistics drivers are compulsive liars. According to tracking my driver left my parcel with no 12 and even put a fake name Archie Fox. I have four houses in my street and no one by that name but this driver put on his machine he gave it to invisible man.I'm finished with Amazon as deliveries get changed at 2 mins to 8 pm deadline and you have to guess when you can expect the delivery. Coming up to black Friday and Christmas they are going to fail big time as they have to many things going on with Pantry, fresh and many other things their dabbling in and its tough if the customer of 12 years suffers. Ta ta Amazon as you've just lost two good customers!!!
results.title: Beware of Amazon Market place sellers All your music!!

results.author: Andra Toma
results.text: Unacceptable experience, dealing with Amazon shows:-they lie with many things (starting from counterfeit products to Customer Service, the very worst! each agent only passes to another and they all tell you will be contacted or called either in 48h or 24h and it never happened. it can take months to solve a simple issue. They seem to have a weird CS department made entirely of bots, their only concern is clicking on the case and "closing it" no matter what they answer, and they don't seem to have the basic authority and competence to solve any issue. They just lie to you to click "answered", no one cares about the customer)-bait and switch tactics-delay in payments to sellers and refunds-when you make an account, you can't remove your financial data from there, it seems to stay in their system and also it is very hard to close your account. I have been going through considerable efforts to remove my data from there and close the account.A shady company with dubious practices facing collapse soon.AVOID AT ALL COSTS
results.title: Unacceptable experience

results.author: Tasha Eden
results.text: I shop at Amazon quite a lot and have never had any issues with quality or delivery would recommend everyone to shop here as it's fast and reliable. I have also found that if I have had any issues like when my tv stick broke customer service is brilliant and very helpful,quick at sending new products out and refunds. Overall I am very pleased with Amazon and will continue to shop here :)
results.title: Never any issues

results.author: Lava Yuki
results.text: Amazon is probably the go-to for most people for online shopping and has been for me since I was a teen. I find Amazon to be a hit and miss depending on what you buy and who you buy it from. 99% of the time I got what I wanted at a better price than I would have on the high street. However, free delivery over 20 is only available on certain items and it's annoying to have to try and spend that much every time without having to pay for delivery, which is something that irks me. A disappointing feature is the fact that Amazon pantry is only available to Prime members which I think is unfair. Prime isn't worth it for me as I don't use any of the other stuff like videos and streaming etc., but I would like to buy some items from the pantry section, so that knocks of a star from my rating. Customer service is slow. I contacted them many times regarding my seller account and they were unable to resolve the issue, yet I still keep receiving emails about funds being in my seller account after 7 odd years but cannot do anything about it. They haven't been helpful in that respect, so I just left it. The emails are annoying though. Overall, a convenient site to find almost anything and at a great price. The reviews are also useful in deciding.
results.title: The internet shopping Go-To site.
